pkgmetadata.longdescription: Raster Randomization for Null Hypothesis Testing // Randomization of presence/absence species distribution raster data with or without including spatial structure for calculating standardized effect sizes and testing null hypothesis. The spatially unstructured randomization algorithms are based on fixed-fixed algorithms for matrices (Gotelli 2000, doi:10.2307/177478). The spatially structured randomization algorithm is based on the preserved richness null model (Laffan Crisp 2003, doi:10.1046/j.1365-2699.2003.00875.x).
